_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan executive summary to comply with 40 CRF 68.155 as amended by [61 FR 31726, June 20, 1996, as amended at 69 FR 18831, Apr. 9, 2004] and California Code of Regulations, Title 19, Division 2, Chapter 4.5 (CalARP).

Location: Air Liquide Electronics U.S. LP, 5121 Brandin Court, Fremont, CA 





THE ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES AT THE STATIONARY SOURCE:

The Fremont ESG location complies with Air Liquide Electronics U.S. LP (ALEUS) policies on process design to reduce probability of release or accident, risk assessment for new and existing processes, incident investigation and reporting, management of change, ready for startup review, process maintenance, and training as accidental release prevention.

The Fremont ESG location maintains, follows, and trains personnel on an Emergency Action Plan.





THE STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED:

The Fremont ESG location is regulated under 29 CFR 1910.119, 40 CFR 68, and CCR Title 19 Division 2, Chapter 4.5 (CalARP Program).  

One co-located, on-site chemical with a maximum intended inventory at or above the threshold quantity (40 CFR 68) is a Federal EPA A`covered processA? and also a CalARP A`covered processA?. The 40 CFR 68 and CalARP regulated substance is storage of hydrogen chloride.

Five additional co-located, on-site chemicals stored with a maximum intended inventory at or above the threshold quantity (CCR Title 19, Division 2, Chapter 4.5) are CalARP A`covered processA?. The CalARP regulated substances are storage of: ammonia, arsine, boron trichloride, and nitric oxide.

All A`covered processA? gases are stored in DOT compliant compressed gas cylinders.





THE GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS:

The chemical specific accidental release and accident prevention steps are those to mitigate risk from toxic gases.

Air LiquideA?s Fremont ESG location reports to the city of Fremont any known release

or threatened release of gaseous hazardous substance which is unplanned.

This facility complies with EPAA?s accident prevention rule, the OSHA PSM standard, and all applicable state and local codes and regulations. 

Air LiquideA?s Fremont ESG location utilizes the following accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source:

a) A`management of changeA? to ensure the covered process is not altered without a safety review
b) operation following written operating procedures
c) training in the process for all operators
d) preventative maintenance
e) pre-startup safety review
f) near miss and incident investigation with corrective and preventative actions
g) hazard review by process hazard analysis procedure
h) use of pressure vessels covered under DOT
i) area electrical classification and conforming equipment
j) hazard communication (OSHA Hazcomm)
k) safety program with monthly meetings
l) hot work program
m) safe work program
n) contractor management program
o) compliance audits

Air LiquideA?s Fremont ESG location utilizes the following chemical specific prevention steps at the stationary source:
a) leak checking equipment prior to operation per standard operating procedure
b) scrubbers to mitigate chemical discharge
c) pressure relief devices as specified by DOT 
d) hazardous gas monitoring and supervised alarms
e) process hazard identification by process hazard analysis
f) fire detectors, sprinklers and alarms
g) operating by following written operating procedures
h) personnel protective equipment
i) housekeeping
j) operating and maintenance training
k) management of change for all changes
l) lockout followed (safe work program)
m) ventilation
n) preventative maintenance
o) emergency action plan training




THE FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:

The owner or operator shall include in the five-year accident history all accidental releases from covered processes that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on sit

e, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.

Air LiquideA?s Fremont ESG location has not had an CalARP or EPA reportable accident in the last five years.

Air LiquideA?s Fremont ESG location investigates all incidents which may result in any leakage under the ALEUS near miss and incident investigation procedure.




THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:

Air LiquideA?s Fremont ESG location has implemented an emergency response program that complies with the requirements of the CalARP RMP as described in 19 CCR Section 2765.2. The ERT consists of 10 fully equipped members that attend yearly training by certified personnel and attend a minimum of quarterly plant training. 





PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:

Air Liquide is committed to providing a safe place of business for the employees and the surrounding community.

Air Liquide identifies areas for improvement by self audit and by process hazard analysis.

To improve safety, Air LiquideA?s Fremont ESG plans to:
*Expand current operating procedure to include unloading trucks during wet or slippery weather
*Further explore the electrical classification for items which may be introduced to the hazardous gas storage location (ex. cellular telephones)
*Add airflow testing to the mechanical integrity program
